programme.title: Moasataf Asal [EGY] vs Paul Coll [NZL] - Men’s Final - QTerminals Qatar Classic 2025 -PSA
programme.desc: World No.1 Mostafa Asal (EGY) meets World No.2 Paul Coll (NZL) at the Khalifa International Tennis & Squash Complex. Asal leads the rivalry and has won the last six meetings. 2025 titles: Asal — World Championship, El Gouna, Optasia; Coll — Canary Wharf, London Classic. Doha record: Asal was 2024 runner-up; Coll reached the finals in 2020 & 2021. Expect fierce T-battles, punishing length, and momentum swings.

programme.title: Gold Standard Ep5
programme.desc: "Heart and Grit in the Desert" – Qatar 2015 The 2015 Championship in Qatar saw France conquer immense pressure to beat the host nation in a gripping final. Led by legends like Omeyer and Karabatić, they earned their fifth title and cemented their legacy.

programme.title: Hania El Hammamy [EGY] vs Nour ElSherbini [EGY] - Women’s Final - QTerminals Qatar Classic 2025 -PS
programme.desc: Defending champion Nour ElSherbini meets Hania El Hammamy in an all-Egyptian blockbuster final in Doha. Defending Qatar Classic champion Nour ElSherbini brings surgical pace and T-dominance—expect rapid volley exchanges and ruthless length. Control of the middle will decide it. ElSherbini reached the final after a straight-games semifinal, while Hania El Hammamy, the 2023 Doha champion, arrives in peak form. A tactical, high-tempo duel for the crown.

programme.title: Olympique Lyonnais vs Toulouse - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Olympique Lyonnais are unbeaten in their last 17 Ligue 1 matches against Toulouse FC, a longer run in the top-flight has only been recorded against Saint-Étienne. Olympique Lyonnais have conceded just three goals in Ligue 1 this season, the joint-lowest tally in the league alongside Nice, and their fewest after six matches of a top-flight campaign since 2015/16.

programme.title: Olympique Lyonnais vs Toulouse - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7

programme.title: Le Havre vs Rennes - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Le Havre have lost four of their last five home games against Rennes in Ligue 1, after only losing one of the first 16. Le Havre failed to score for the third time in Ligue 1 in 2025 in their last match at Metz ; only Lyon and Paris SG have failed to score in fewer matches in the competition this calendar year among ever present teams. It was also Le Havre’s second clean sheet of the year, the lowest tally amongst all teams in Ligue 1.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab.Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan

programme.title: History of the Asian Games
programme.desc: From its beginnings to today, the Asian Games torch lighting has become a dazzling showcase of creativity and technology. Each edition brings fresh innovation, with Doha 2006’s unforgettable horse-and-rider moment still hailed as a highlight. As the 2026 Games in Japan draw near, excitement builds over what new spectacle will capture the world’s imagination.

programme.title: Leeds United vs Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Leeds United vs Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost just two of their last 30 league games against Sunderland, with this their first since a 3-0 win in April 2017. Across all competitions, Sunderland have managed to win just one of their last 31 away games against Manchester United, winning 1-0 in May 2014 thanks to Sebastian Larsson’s winner.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost just two of their last 30 league games against Sunderland, with this their first since a 3-0 win in April 2017. programme.title: Chelsea vs Liverpool -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won six of their last seven league meetings with Nottingham Forest, including their last three in a row since a 1-3 defeat in December 2023. The Magpies last won more in succession over the Tricky Trees in March 1937. Nottingham Forest have lost eight of their last nine league visits to Newcastle United, conceding 24 goals in this period.

programme.title: Leeds United vs Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Leeds United have lost nine of their last 11 Premier League games against Tottenham Hotspur, including each of their last four in a row – their longest ever league losing run to Spurs. Tottenham have won both of their last two league visits to Elland Road and could beat Leeds United away from home three times running in the league for the very first time.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost just two of their last 30 league games against Sunderland, with this their first since a 3-0 win in April 2017. Across all competitions, Sunderland have managed to win just one of their last 31 away games against Manchester United, winning 1-0 in May 2014 thanks to Sebastian Larsson’s winner.

programme.title: Chelsea vs Liverpool -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: Arsenal vs West Ham United - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Arsenal have lost both of their last two home league games against West Ham, only ever losing three in a row once before. West Ham United are looking to become only the second side to win three successive Premier League away games against Arsenal, after Manchester City, who won six on the bounce from March 2018 to February 2023.

programme.title: Chelsea vs Liverpool -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. Liverpool are winless in their last four Premier League games at Stamford Bridge and could lose away to Chelsea two seasons running in the league for the first time since losing three on the bounce from 2004-05 to 2006-07.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost just two of their last 30 league games against Sunderland, with this their first since a 3-0 win in April 2017. Across all competitions, Sunderland have managed to win just one of their last 31 away games against Manchester United, winning 1-0 in May 2014 thanks to Sebastian Larsson’s winner.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: EPL The Big Interview 2025/2026
programme.desc: Extended sit-downs and more informal ‘out and about’ interviews with the Premier League’s biggest stars, providing players with a platform to tell their story in their own words.

programme.title: UEFA UCL Magazine 2025/2026 - MD2 Review
programme.desc: A recap of the best of the action, plus a look forward to the next Match Day in Europe’s premium football competition, the UEFA Champions League. The 2025/26 UEFA Champions League will be the second to be played under the new 36-team league phase. All matches from the UEFA Champions League are live and exclusive only on beIN with a choice of Arabic or English commentary.

programme.title: European Qualifiers MD 7 & MD8 Preview - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - Magazine
programme.desc: MD7 & MD8 Preview of the European Qualifiers for the FIFA World Cup 2026

programme.title: Newcastle United vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won six of their last seven league meetings with Nottingham Forest, including their last three in a row since a 1-3 defeat in December 2023. The Magpies last won more in succession over the Tricky Trees in March 1937. Nottingham Forest have lost eight of their last nine league visits to Newcastle United, conceding 24 goals in this period.

programme.title: Brentford vs Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Brentford have won four of their last six Premier League home games, scoring at least twice in five of those matches. This comes after an eight game winless run at Gtech Community Stadium, a run in which they failed to score on five occasions. Manchester City are the only side to have spent more than half of their game time in a winning position in the Premier League this season. The Citizens have spent over two hours in the lead in their last two away league games, but have failed to win either match.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Galatasaray vs Liverpool - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2 - Mini Match
programme.desc: The 2025–26 UEFA Champions League is live and exclusive only on beIN. Paris Saint-Germain are the defending champions. The 2025/26 UEFA Champions League will be the second to be played under the new 36-team league phase. The final will be played on 30 May 2026 at Puskás Aréna in Budapest, Hungary.

programme.desc: Sevilla have not won any of their last 19 LaLiga games against Barcelona, a run that stretches back to October 2015, losing their last seven in a row – their longest consecutive losing streak against the Catalans in the top-flight. Barcelona have avoided defeat in their last nine away LaLiga matches against Sevilla, their longest unbeaten run away to them in the competition.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Arsenal - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won each of their last three home games against Arsenal in all competitions without conceding a single goal, while they last won four in a row at home to the Gunners in August 1969. programme.desc: Newcastle United have won each of their last three home games against Arsenal in all competitions without conceding a single goal, while they last won four in a row at home to the Gunners in August 1969. programme.title: Crystal Palace vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Crystal Palace have won just one of their last 16 Premier League meetings with Liverpool, winning 1-0 at Anfield in April 2024. The Eagles haven’t scored more than once in any of their last 12 league games against the Reds. Liverpool have won nine and lost none of their last 10 away league games against Crystal Palace – this is their longest ongoing unbeaten run away from home in the league against any side.

programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Brentford have won two of their last three home Premier League games against Manchester United, as many as their first six home league matches versus the Red Devils beforehand. programme.title: Brentford vs. Manchester United - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Brentford have won two of their last three home Premier League games against Manchester United, as many as their first six home league matches versus the Red Devils beforehand. After their 4-3 defeat in May, Manchester United could lose back-to-back league meetings with Brentford for only the third time, after previously doing so in the second tier in December 1934 and top-flight in February 1937.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Arsenal - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won each of their last three home games against Arsenal in all competitions without conceding a single goal, while they last won four in a row at home to the Gunners in August 1969. Under Mikel Arteta, Arsenal have only lost more away games at Manchester City in all competitions than they have away to Newcastle United.

programme.title: Newcastle United vs. Arsenal - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won each of their last three home games against Arsenal in all competitions without conceding a single goal, while they last won four in a row at home to the Gunners in August 1969. programme.title: Crystal Palace vs. Liverpool - English Premier League 2025/2026
programme.desc: Crystal Palace have won just one of their last 16 Premier League meetings with Liverpool, winning 1-0 at Anfield in April 2024. The Eagles haven’t scored more than once in any of their last 12 league games against the Reds. Liverpool have won nine and lost none of their last 10 away league games against Crystal Palace – this is their longest ongoing unbeaten run away from home in the league against any side.

programme.title: Leeds United vs. Tottenham Hotspur - English Premier League 2025/2026

programme.title: Manchester United vs Sunderland - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost just two of their last 30 league games against Sunderland, with this their first since a 3-0 win in April 2017. programme.title: Chelsea vs Liverpool -English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: After their 3-1 win in May, Chelsea could enjoy back-to-back league wins over Liverpool for the first time since November 2014. programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: Arsenal vs West Ham United - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Arsenal have lost both of their last two home league games against West Ham, only ever losing three in a row once before. West Ham United are looking to become only the second side to win three successive Premier League away games against Arsenal, after Manchester City, who won six on the bounce from March 2018 to February 2023.

programme.title: UEFA UCL Magazine 2025/2026 - MD2 Review
programme.desc: A recap of the best of the action, plus a look forward to the next Match Day in Europe’s premium football competition, the UEFA Champions League. programme.desc: MD7 & MD8 Preview of the European Qualifiers for the FIFA World Cup 2026

programme.title: Newcastle United vs Nottingham Forest - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Newcastle United have won six of their last seven league meetings with Nottingham Forest, including their last three in a row since a 1-3 defeat in December 2023. The Magpies last won more in succession over the Tricky Trees in March 1937. Nottingham Forest have lost eight of their last nine league visits to Newcastle United, conceding 24 goals in this period.

programme.title: Brentford vs Manchester City - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 8
programme.desc: Brentford have won four of their last six Premier League home games, scoring at least twice in five of those matches. This comes after an eight game winless run at Gtech Community Stadium, a run in which they failed to score on five occasions. Manchester City are the only side to have spent more than half of their game time in a winning position in the Premier League this season. The Citizens have spent over two hours in the lead in their last two away league games, but have failed to win either match.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Galatasaray vs Liverpool - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2 - Mini Match

programme.desc: Sevilla have not won any of their last 19 LaLiga games against Barcelona, a run that stretches back to October 2015, losing their last seven in a row – their longest consecutive losing streak against the Catalans in the top-flight. Barcelona have avoided defeat in their last nine away LaLiga matches against Sevilla, their longest unbeaten run away to them in the competition.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Real Madrid have not lost any of their last four LaLiga games against Villarreal, winning the last two, this after failing to win any of their previous four against the Yellows in the competition. They have not won three or more in a row against them in LaLiga since 2011. Villarreal have lost 17 of their 25 LaLiga away matches against Real Madrid, their highest number of away defeats against a single opponent in the competition.

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Chengdu Rongcheng FC vs Gangwon FC (KOR) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: Chengdu Rongcheng will face Gangwon for the first time in AFC Champions League Elite; each of the last three games in the competition between teams from Korea and China have been won by the former by an exact 2-1 score, including Gangwon’s win over Shanghai Shenhua in the first round of the 2025-26 season. Gangwon beat Shanghai Shenhua 2-1 in their first ever AFC Champions League Elite game at home; the last Korean side to suffer at least one defeat in their first two games in the competition is Jeju United in 2011, while no side from Korea has suffered defeat in their first away game in the AFC Champions League Elite.

programme.title: Chelsea vs Benfica - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2
programme.desc: Chelsea have won all four of their competitive meetings with Benfica, with the most recent of those coming earlier this year at the FIFA Club World Cup. This will be the first meeting between Chelsea and Benfica in the group/league phase of a competition, with the previous four all having come in the knockout stages: UEFA Champions League quarter-finals in 2011-12, UEFA Europa League final in 2012-13 and the FIFA Club World Cup last 16 earlier this year.

programme.title: GP Confidential 2025 Magazine
programme.desc: Explore the sporting secrets of F1. Across 25 episodes and in crisp 3D animations, we analyses the technical details, which decide which teams make the most of the rules - and which need to go back to the drawing board. Complemented by features on historical milestones as well as race previews - GP Confidential is the perfect treat for any F1 fan.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. programme.title: Arturo Coello (ESP) / Agustin Tapia (ARG) vs Federico Chingotto (ARG) / Alejandro Galan (ESP) - Men
programme.desc: Top seeds Arturo Coello/Agustín Tapia clash with No.2 Alejandro Galán/Federico Chingotto. Coello/Tapia dominated most of 2025, but Galán/Chingotto struck back with victory in Germany P2. Head-to-head favors Coello/Tapia, yet momentum is split after recent meetings. Indoor conditions at Rotterdam Ahoy amplify aggressive volleys and x-3 smashes, setting up a high-stakes P1 decider.

programme.title: Toulouse vs AIX - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Day 2 - Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe 2025
Day 2 - Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe 2025
The Art of lighting the Asian Games Flame
programme.desc: The Asian Games torch lighting has become a stage for innovation, blending tradition with modern spectacle. From iconic moments to dazzling surprises, none stand out more than Doha 2006 with its dramatic horse and rider. As the 2026 Games approach in Japan, anticipation grows for the next unforgettable torch lighting ceremony.

programme.title: Cesson-Rennes vs Montpellier - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Nantes vs Saint-Raphaël - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: Arturo Coello (ESP) / Agustin Tapia (ARG) vs Federico Chingotto (ARG) / Alejandro Galan (ESP) - Men
programme.desc: Top seeds Arturo Coello/Agustín Tapia clash with No.2 Alejandro Galán/Federico Chingotto. Coello/Tapia dominated most of 2025, but Galán/Chingotto struck back with victory in Germany P2. Head-to-head favors Coello/Tapia, yet momentum is split after recent meetings. Indoor conditions at Rotterdam Ahoy amplify aggressive volleys and x-3 smashes, setting up a high-stakes P1 decider.
